title: How to Knit a Tea Pot Cozy

steps.headline: Loosely CO 60 sts (in rib) and join in the round (be careful, don't  twist)
Handle hole: *K2, FPR for 56 sts, K2, turn.
steps.description: Rep. from * to end for 6 more rows.

steps.headline: Spout hole: K2, FPR for 24 sts, DD, K1, turn.
steps.description: *K2, FPR for 24 sts, k2, TURN. Rep. from * for 11 rows.

steps.headline: Break off yarn and join on to the other side at the bottom of the spout hole
DD, K1, FBR for 24 sts, K2, TURN.
steps.description: *K2, FBR for 24 rows, K2, TURN. Rep. from * for 11 more rows.

steps.headline: Closing the spout hole: K2, FPR for 24 sts, FPR over the next 4 garter sts the same way you would for the foundation round, FPR for the next 24 sts, K2, TURN.
steps.description: K2, FBR for 52 sts, K2, TURN. Rep. from * for 3 more rows.

steps.headline: K2T, K3T, *FBR for the next 5 sts, K3T.
steps.description: Repeat from * to last 2 sts, K2T. DO NOT TURN.

steps.headline: Continue around in CPR starting with P1, S1P, YRN, P1 with its accompanying loop.
Work 3 rounds of P1 K1 rib, starting with P1
Cut a piece of hat elastic and run it through the bottom of the cozy (wrong side) and tighten, making sure that it is big enough to fit over you Teapot.

text: Loosely CO 60 sts (in rib) and join in the round (be careful, don't  twist)  Work CPR for 6 rounds  Handle hole: *K2, FPR for 56 sts, K2, turn. Rep. from * to end for 6 more rows. Spout hole: K2, FPR for 24 sts, DD, K1, turn. *K2, FPR for 24 sts, k2, TURN. Rep. from * for 11 rows. Break off yarn and join on to the other side at the bottom of the spout hole  DD, K1, FBR for 24 sts, K2, TURN. *K2, FBR for 24 rows, K2, TURN. Rep. from * for 11 more rows. Closing the spout hole: K2, FPR for 24 sts, FPR over the next 4 garter sts the same way you would for the foundation round, FPR for the next 24 sts, K2, TURN. K2, FBR for 52 sts, K2, TURN. Rep. from * for 3 more rows. K2T, K3T, *FBR for the next 5 sts, K3T. Repeat from * to last 2 sts, K2T. DO NOT TURN. Continue around in CPR starting with P1, S1P, YRN, P1 with its accompanying loop. Do another 8 rounds of CPR P1, K3T 10 times  Work 3 rounds of P1 K1 rib, starting with P1  K2T 10 times  CO, weave ends.  Cut a piece of hat elastic and run it through the bottom of the cozy (wrong side) and tighten, making sure that it is big enough to fit over you Teapot. Tie the knot.
